item.title: Github Project
item.description:
After successfully setting up hexth.com, I realised that I’m pushing the whole Hugo site folder onto Github. While I do not have much of an issue with this, I think it can be better streamlined if only the public folder get uploaded to Github.

Too happy with having hexth.com working, I was a bit hesitant to mess with it too much and decided to create a Github Project page instead. I started with a new repo on Github named cv. The site itself was created with Hugo locally. Instead of initialising git for the whole site folder, I initiated git only in the public folder this time and then set up Hugo as usual.

item.title: Update on Hugo
item.description:
Successfully deployed Hugo on Github. Encountered some issues with Github Action but I ended up using a preset instead of following the guide. Next issue to tackle is custom domain.

I’ve recently acquired hexth.com after its registration expired and decided to keep it together with hexth.net for the time being. I then set up hexth.com for this page and encountered a few difficulties; Github cant resolve the new domain properly until I did my domain verification, this issue resolved itself once domain verification was completed and https enforced.
